titleStmt.title: An enterlude for children to play named Iack Iugler bothe wittie and very plesant. Newly imprinted. The names of the players. Maister Boungrace Dame Coy Iack Iugler Ienkin Careaway Alice trip and go. A gallant a gentlewoman The vice A lackey A maid.
Jack Juggler.
titleStmt.author: Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo.

publicationStmt.publisher: At the long shop adioyning vnto Saint Mildreds Churche in the Pultrie, by Iohn Allde,

notesStmt.note: Based on: Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo.
The words "Maister .. go." and "A gallant .. maid." are bracketed together on title page.
Identified as STC 14837+ on UMI microfilm reel 379.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and the Folger Shakespeare Library.
Appears at reel 379 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy, leaves D2.3 only) and at reel 715 (Folger Shakespeare Library copy).

place.placeName: the long shop adioyning vnto Saint Mildreds Churche in the Pultrie
